# MechWarrior 5: Clans

| genre = Vehicle simulation
| modes = Single-player, multiplayer
}}
MechWarrior 5: Clans is a vehicle simulation video game, developed by Piranha Games and published by Enad Global 7, released worldwide on October 16, 2024. It is a standalone expansion of MechWarrior 5: Mercenaries, based on the BattleTech/MechWarrior game universe.
Synopsis
MechWarrior 5: Clans is set in the BattleTech universe. The player plays the role of star commander Jayden of a Clan Smoke Jaguar star, during the start and middle of the Clan invasion.
Gameplay
Mechwarrior 5: Clans largley followed the mech combat and management established in MechWarrior 5: Mercenaries, but in terms of overall structure of the campaign, it instead provided a more linear campaign structure with a much heavier emphasis on narrative presentation. Using the new toolsets provided by Unreal Engine 5, Piranha Games produced pre-rendered cinematic cutscenes that emphasized voice acting and motion-capture performances.
Downloadable Content
Trials of War
Mechwarrrior 5: Clans received its first downloadable content (DLC) with the Trials of War expansion on November 25 [https://steamdb.info/app/3323880/] and was initially sold for 19.99 USD on release. This DLC offered new gameplay systems with 5-player PvP Arena Mode, co-op Horde Mode, and 12 new Omnimech variants. The DLC was received negatively by both critics[https://www.cgmagonline.com/review/game/mechwarrior-5-clans-trials-of-war/] and fans[https://www.reddit.com/r/Mechwarrior5/comments/1gzs576/is_anyone_else_extremely_disappointed_with_trials/] and Piranha Games made it free, refunded those who bought it, and absorbed the DLC into the base Mechwarrior 5: Clans game [https://mw5clans.com/news/2024/12/135-hot-fix-5-and-trials-of-war-update].
Ghost Bear Flash Storm
On May 7, 2025, MechWarrior 5: Clans received its first story-focused expansion with a new 12 mission campaign that followed a new cast of characters from Clan Ghost Bear and set in the same time period as the base game's Clan Smoke Jaguar campaign. The DLC also included 4 new OmniMechs and 4 new BattleMechs and introduced 'elementals' as a smaller support unit which had not appeared in the MechWarrior series since MechWarrior 3. The expansion was received positively by critics[https://worthplaying.com/article/2025/5/30/reviews/146242-pc-review-mechwarrior-5-clans-ghost-bear-flash-storm-dlc/] and players[https://steamdb.info/app/3463200/charts/#reviews]. According to the publisher Enad Global 7, Ghost Bear Flash Storm performed commercially "nicely" and "within expectations" [https://storage.mfn.se/26402af9-a0e1-49f2-886f-950553657fc0/q1-2025-interim-report.pdf].
Wolves of Tukayyid
On November 5, 2025, Piranha Games announced they are developing a second story-focused DLC Wolves of Tukayyid set to release on December 4 2025 [https://mw5clans.com/news/2025/11/172-new-clans-dlc-wolves-of-tukayyid]. The DLC features 20 new missions focused on Clan Wolf and with six new 'Mech chassis.
Reception
| PCGUS = 82/100
| IGN = 80/100

As of November 2024, MechWarrior 5: Clans had "Generally Favorable" reviews according to review aggregator Metacritic.
